### Critical n8n Flaw (CVSS 9.9) Enables Arbitrary Code Execution Across Thousands of Instances


üìä **TECH INSIGHT**


The article discusses a critical security flaw in n8n, an open-source workflow automation tool, identified as a CVSS 9.9 vulnerability. This flaw enables arbitrary code execution, potentially affecting thousands of instances globally. It highlights the serious risk posed to users, as attackers could exploit this vulnerability to gain unauthorized access or control over n8n deployments. The article emphasizes the urgency for users to update their systems and apply available patches to mitigate potential security breaches.

**[Read the full article ‚Ä∫](https://thehackernews.com/2025/12/critical-n8n-flaw-cvss-99-enables.html?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=weekly_ai_cybersecurity&utm_content=article_6055)**


---


### Gemma Scope 2: helping the AI safety community deepen understanding of complex language model behavior


üß† **AI ADVANCEMENT**


The article "Gemma Scope 2: Helping the AI Safety Community Deepen Understanding of Complex Language Model Behavior" discusses the launch of Gemma Scope 2, a tool designed to aid the AI safety community in exploring and analyzing the nuanced behaviors of complex language models. By providing advanced visualization and interpretability features, Gemma Scope 2 aims to enhance the understanding of AI models' decision-making processes, identify potential risks, and ensure safer deployment of these technologies. The tool facilitates deeper engagement with language

**[Read the full article ‚Ä∫](https://deepmind.google/blog/gemma-scope-2-helping-the-ai-safety-community-deepen-understanding-of-complex-language-model-behavior/?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=weekly_ai_cybersecurity&utm_content=article_9687)**


---


### From Linear to Complex: An Upgrade in RansomHouse Encryption


üìä **TECH INSIGHT**


The article discusses a significant advancement in the encryption techniques used by the hacker group RansomHouse. Previously employing relatively straightforward linear methods, RansomHouse has upgraded to more sophisticated, complex encryption algorithms to enhance their cyberattacks. This move makes it more challenging for victims and cybersecurity professionals to decrypt affected data, thereby increasing the urgency and pressure to pay ransoms. The article highlights the growing trend of cybercriminals adopting advanced technologies to stay ahead of security measures, affecting both individuals and organizations globally.

**[Read the full article ‚Ä∫](https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/ransomhouse-encryption-upgrade/?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=weekly_ai_cybersecurity&utm_content=article_1713)**


---

The article dives into the major incidents, detailing a spectrum of breaches that ranged from bizarre and unexpected attacks to those with significant global ramifications. It examines how these breaches not only targeted traditional sectors but also infiltrated emerging technologies, causing

### Two Chrome Extensions Caught Secretly Stealing Credentials from Over 170 Sites


üìä **TECH INSIGHT**


Security researchers have identified two malicious Google Chrome extensions responsible for covertly stealing user credentials from over 170 websites. These extensions, masquerading as legitimate tools, managed to deceive users into installing them and subsequently harvested sensitive login information without their knowledge. The breach highlights ongoing security challenges within browser extension ecosystems, underscoring the importance of rigorous vetting processes for such software. While the specific names of the extensions weren't disclosed, Google has since removed them from the Chrome Web Store and has advised users to uninstall them

**[Read the full article ‚Ä∫](https://thehackernews.com/2025/12/two-chrome-extensions-caught-secretly.html?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=weekly_ai_cybersecurity&utm_content=article_2366)**
